trans-unit.source: Create an Azure RemoteApp image based on an Azure VM
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure RemoteApp image based on an Azure VM

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create an image for Azure RemoteApp by starting with an Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create an image for Azure RemoteApp by starting with an Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Create a Azure RemoteApp image based on an Azure virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Create a Azure RemoteApp image based on an Azure virtual machine

trans-unit.source: You can create Azure RemoteApp images (which hold the apps you share in your collection) from an Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You can create Azure RemoteApp images (which hold the apps you share in your collection) from an Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You could also choose to use a virtual machine image we added to the Azure VM image gallery that meets all the Azure RemoteApp image requirements - you can use that VM image as a starting point for your own VM, if you want.
trans-unit.target: You could also choose to use a virtual machine image we added to the Azure VM image gallery that meets all the Azure RemoteApp image requirements - you can use that VM image as a starting point for your own VM, if you want.

trans-unit.source: Just look for the "Windows Server Remote Desktop Session Host" image in the library.
trans-unit.target: Just look for the "Windows Server Remote Desktop Session Host" image in the library.

trans-unit.source: There are two steps to create your own image based on an Azure VM - create the image and then upload it from the Azure VM library to Azure RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: There are two steps to create your own image based on an Azure VM - create the image and then upload it from the Azure VM library to Azure RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: Create a custom image based on an Azure VM
trans-unit.target: Create a custom image based on an Azure VM

trans-unit.source: Use these steps to create an image based on an Azure VM.
trans-unit.target: Use these steps to create an image based on an Azure VM.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can use the “Windows Server Remote Desktop Session Host” image from the Azure virtual machine image gallery.
trans-unit.target: You can use the “Windows Server Remote Desktop Session Host” image from the Azure virtual machine image gallery.

trans-unit.source: This image meets all the Azure RemoteApp template image requirements.
trans-unit.target: This image meets all the Azure RemoteApp template image requirements.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Create a VM running Windows](virtual-machines-windows-tutorial.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Create a VM running Windows](virtual-machines-windows-tutorial.md).

trans-unit.source: Connect to the VM and install and configure the apps that you want to share through RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the VM and install and configure the apps that you want to share through RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to perform any additional Windows configurations required by your apps.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to perform any additional Windows configurations required by your apps.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [How to Log on to a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server](virtual-machines-log-on-windows-server.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [How to Log on to a Virtual Machine Running Windows Server](virtual-machines-log-on-windows-server.md).

trans-unit.source: If you are using the Windows Server Remote Desktop Session Host image, there is an included validation script that will ensure your VM meets the RemoteApp pre-reqs.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the Windows Server Remote Desktop Session Host image, there is an included validation script that will ensure your VM meets the RemoteApp pre-reqs.

trans-unit.source: To run script, double-click **ValidateRemoteAppImage** on the desktop.
trans-unit.target: To run script, double-click **ValidateRemoteAppImage** on the desktop.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that all errors reported by the script are fixed before proceeding to the next step.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that all errors reported by the script are fixed before proceeding to the next step.

trans-unit.source: SYSPREP generalize and capture the image.
trans-unit.target: SYSPREP generalize and capture the image.

trans-unit.source: See [How to Capture a Windows Virtual Machine to Use as a Template](../virtual-machines-capture-image-windows-server.md) for instructions.
trans-unit.target: See [How to Capture a Windows Virtual Machine to Use as a Template](../virtual-machines-capture-image-windows-server.md) for instructions.

trans-unit.source: Import the image into the Azure RemoteApp image library
trans-unit.target: Import the image into the Azure RemoteApp image library

trans-unit.source: Use these steps to import the new image into Azure RemoteApp:
trans-unit.target: Use these steps to import the new image into Azure RemoteApp:

trans-unit.source: In the **Template Images** tab:
trans-unit.target: In the **Template Images** tab:

trans-unit.source: If you have no existing images, click **Upload or Import a Template Image**.
trans-unit.target: If you have no existing images, click **Upload or Import a Template Image**.

trans-unit.source: If you have at least one image already, click **+** to add a new image.
trans-unit.target: If you have at least one image already, click **+** to add a new image.

trans-unit.source: Select **Import an image from your Virtual Machines** library, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Import an image from your Virtual Machines** library, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the next page, select your custom image from the list and confirm that you followed the steps listed when you created your image.
trans-unit.target: On the next page, select your custom image from the list and confirm that you followed the steps listed when you created your image.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the new RemoteApp image and pick the location, then click the checkmark to start the import process.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the new RemoteApp image and pick the location, then click the checkmark to start the import process.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can import images from any Azure location supported by Azure Virtual Machines to any Azure location supported by Azure RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can import images from any Azure location supported by Azure Virtual Machines to any Azure location supported by Azure RemoteApp.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the locations the import can take up to 25 minutes.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the locations the import can take up to 25 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Now you are ready to create your new collection, either a [cloud](remoteapp-create-cloud-deployment.md) collection or [hybrid](remoteapp-create-hybrid-deployment.md), depending on your needs.
trans-unit.target: Now you are ready to create your new collection, either a [cloud](remoteapp-create-cloud-deployment.md) collection or [hybrid](remoteapp-create-hybrid-deployment.md), depending on your needs.
